intro: Secamone macrophylla, commonly known as the large-leaf secamone, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It is characterized by its broad, glossy leaves and showy, fragrant flowers that typically bloom in shades of yellow and orange. The plant belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. Secamone macrophylla is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and shrublands. Its botanical features make it a notable species in both horticultural and ecological contexts.
